title: N2O5 decomposition - rate order from pressure data

content.question: A sample of N2O5 was placed in an evacuated container, and the reaction represented above occurred. The value of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msub> <mi>P</mi> <mrow> <msub> <mi>N</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <msub> <mi>O</mi> <mn>5</mn> </msub> </mrow> </msub> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D8F@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, the partial pressure of N2O5(g), was measured during the reaction and recorded in the table below. Which of the following correctly describes the reaction?

choices.label: The decomposition of N2O5 is a zero-order reaction.
The decomposition of N2O5 is a first-order reaction.
The decomposition of N2O5 is a second-order reaction.

content.answer: The decomposition of N2O5 is a first-order reaction.

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
